alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Knott; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 4:58AM EDT until July 28 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR SOUTHERN BREATHITT, NORTHERN PERRY, AND EASTERN OWSLEY... The National Weather Service in Jackson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Breathitt County in southeastern Kentucky... Northwestern Knott County in southeastern Kentucky... Northeastern Owsley County in southeastern Kentucky... Northwestern Perry County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 745 AM EDT. * At 458 AM EDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for southern Breathitt, northern Perry, and eastern Owsley. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Booneville, Buckhorn, Whick, Little, Saldee, Wolf Coal, Copland, Howard Creek, Altro, Bush Branch, Barwick, Haddix, Curt, Canoe, Beech, Watts, Talbert, Lost Creek, Crockettsville and Sebastian`s Branch. Numerous roads are closed and life threatening flooding is occurring throughout the area. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
